Linting with Flake8

We use Flake8 <http://flake8.pycqa.org/en/latest/index.html>`_ to "lint" our code. Linting, from the ``C language, is an automatic inspection of code that looks for sloppy technique or other suspicious things. It’s frequently used to enforce compliance to standard Python coding guidelines like PEP8 [https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0008/].

The run of Flake8 is configured by a .flake8 file in the top directory. We’ve tweaked it to allow 96-character long lines instead of the more restricive (and less readable) 72 characters PEP8 recommends; in a world of big screens, 72 decreases readability.
